title: What is HTML? A beginner friendly guide to HTML.
description:
HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language and is the standard language used to create web pages. It is a markup language, meaning it is used to describe the structure and content of a web page, but not its appearance.

A beginner's guide to HTML:

  1. What is HTML? HTML is a markup language that is used to create web pages. It consists of a series of tags that are used to define the structure and content of a web page.

  2. How does HTML work? HTML works by using tags to define the structure and content of a web page. For example, the tag <html> is used to define the start of an HTML document, and the tag </html> is used to define the end of the document.

  3. Basic HTML tags Here are some of the most common HTML tags:

  • <html> – Defines the start of an HTML document.
  • <head> – Defines the header of the document.
  • <title> – Defines the title of the document.
  • <body> – Defines the body of the document.
  • <h1> – Defines a level 1 heading.
  • <p> – Defines a paragraph.
  • <a> – Defines a hyperlink.
  • <img> – Defines an image.
  1. HTML example Here is a basic HTML example:
<html> <head> <title>My First HTML Page</title> </head> <body> <h1>Welcome to my website</h1> <p>This is my first HTML page.</p> <p><a href="https://www.example.com">Learn more about HTML</a></p> <img src="image.jpg" alt="An example image"> </body> </html>
  1. Conclusion HTML is a powerful and flexible language that is used to create web pages. It is the foundation of the web, and understanding HTML is an essential part of being a web developer. By using the tags and examples provided in this guide, you can start creating your own HTML pages.
